title: Fix empty package.json and add required dependencies

requirements.text: Create complete frontend/package.json with all required dependencies including React, TypeScript, Vite, TanStack Router, TanStack Query, @dfinity/agent, @dfinity/auth-client, @dfinity/candid, @dfinity/principal, Tailwind CSS, and all other necessary packages for the React + Internet Computer application

quotes: when i try to install it throws error and the packages.json file is empty

acceptanceCriteria: package.json exists in frontend directory with non-empty content
All React and TypeScript dependencies are present with compatible versions
All Internet Computer dependencies (@dfinity packages) are included
TanStack Router and TanStack Query are listed as dependencies
Tailwind CSS and related build tools are configured
Scripts section includes dev, build, and preview commands
npm install runs without errors in the frontend directory

requirements.text: Create frontend/package-lock.json with resolved dependency tree matching the package.json configuration to enable proper npm install execution
acceptanceCriteria: All dependencies from package.json are resolved with specific versions
Dependency tree includes all transitive dependencies
File enables npm install to complete successfully without fetching issues

requirements.text: Ensure frontend/vite.config.ts or frontend/vite.config.js exists with proper configuration for React, TypeScript support, and Internet Computer environment variables
acceptanceCriteria: Vite config file exists with React plugin configured
Environment variable handling is configured for VITE_* or import.meta.env
Build output directory and public directory are properly set

constraints: Must use React with TypeScript as specified in the existing codebase
Must include all @dfinity packages required for Internet Computer integration
Must maintain compatibility with existing frontend code structure (TanStack Router, hooks, components)
Package versions must be mutually compatible to avoid dependency conflicts
nonGoals: Adding Next.js dependencies (the project uses Vite + React, not Next.js)
Adding Flask or Python dependencies (backend issue is separate)
Changing the existing frontend architecture or file structure
Migrating to a different bundler or framework
